message_1: Suppose A = {x | -2 < x < 4} and B = {x | 0 < x < 6}. Find the intersection of A and B.
message_2:
To find the intersection of sets A and B, we need to find the set of all elements that are common to both A and B.

Set A contains all elements x such that -2 < x < 4.
Set B contains all elements x such that 0 < x < 6.

The intersection of A and B will contain all elements x that satisfy both conditions. In other words, we need to find the range of x values that are greater than -2 and less than 4, as well as greater than 0 and less than 6.

Since 0 is greater than -2, we can ignore the -2 < x condition, as it is already satisfied by the 0 < x condition. Now we just need to find the range of x values that are both less than 4 and less than 6.

Since 4 is less than 6, the intersection of A and B will contain all elements x such that 0 < x < 4.

Therefore, the intersection of A and B is the set {x | 0 < x < 4}.
